text: What's the best way to group contacts?
response:
To segment contacts:
1. Open the 'Contacts' menu → 'Advanced Filtering'
2. Choose segmentation criteria (engagement, tags, etc.)
3. Create a new group using those filters
4. Save the segment for future use

Segmentation helps you target more precisely!

```
}
```

text: Setup webhook
response:
To set up a webhook in Chattea:
1. Log in to the dashboard
2. Go to Settings → Webhooks
3. Add your webhook URL (e.g., https://example.com/webhook)
4. Choose the events you want to receive
5. Save and test the webhook

Chattea will send POST requests to your URL when events occur.

text: How to turn off auto reply please
response:
To disable auto-reply:
1. Go to Settings → Auto Reply
2. Toggle OFF for 'Auto Reply Outside Business Hours'
3. Or adjust the schedule for when auto-reply is active
4. Click Save

Auto-reply is now disabled!

text: Could you show me how to manage uploaded files
response:
To manage uploaded files:
1. Open the 'Files' tab
2. See all your files (images, PDFs, videos)
3. Click a file to preview
4. Delete files you don’t need

Files are retained for 30 days after the last upload.

text: Can I schedule messages across time zones thanks
response:
Chattea supports timezone scheduling!

When scheduling messages:
1. Choose the recipient’s timezone
2. Set local time for the recipient
3. Chattea will convert automatically

Example: Schedule for Jakarta (WIB) at 09:00; Batam (WIB) will also be 09:00 automatically.

text: QR code pairing please
response:
To pair WhatsApp with Chattea:

Method 1: QR Code (Recommended)
1. Create a new instance
2. Scan the QR code with WhatsApp on your phone:
   - Open WhatsApp → Settings → Linked Devices
   - Tap 'Link a Device'
   - Scan the QR shown in Chattea

Method 2: Pairing Code
1. Click 'Use Pairing Code'
2. Enter your phone number
3. Chattea will generate a code
4. Enter the code in WhatsApp on your phone

Done! Instance connected!

   ⏳ Pending – Awaiting confirmation
   ❌ Failed – Payment failed

If pending for over 24 hours, contact support!

text: Can you tell me how to make new template thank you
response:
To create a message template:
1. 'Templates' tab → 'New Template'
2. Name the template (e.g., 'Weekend Promo')
3. Write the message with variables:
   - {name} = Contact name
   - {phone} = Phone number
   - {custom} = Custom field
4. Save the template

Example:
```
Hello {name}! 👋
Special weekend promo for you!
20% off all products.
Code: WEEKEND20
```

Template is ready for blasts!

text: Could you apply template
response:
To use a template:
1. When creating a new blast/message
2. Click 'Use Template'
3. Choose a template (e.g., 'Weekend Promo')
4. The template will auto-fill in the message box
5. Edit if needed
6. Send!

The {name} variable will automatically be replaced with the contact’s name!

text: Internet requirements
response:
Internet connection requirements:

📶 Minimum:
- 512 Kbps (0.5 Mbps)
- Latency < 300 ms

🚀 Recommended:
- 2 Mbps or more
- Latency < 100 ms
- Stable connection (no drops)

⚠️ Avoid:
- Unsafe public WiFi
- Mobile connection while traveling
- Slow VPNs

💡 Tips:
- Use WiFi/cable for large blasts
- Restart your router if slow
- Close other bandwidth-heavy apps

Stable connection = smooth delivery!

text: My instance disconnected—how to fix?
response:
Instance disconnected? Try this:

1️⃣ Check your internet connection:
   - Test speed at speedtest.net
   - Ensure it’s stable

2️⃣ Reconnect the instance:
   - 'Instances' tab → select instance
   - Click 'Reconnect'
   - Rescan QR code

   - Close WhatsApp
   - Clear cache (optional)
   - Reopen & check linked devices

4️⃣ Check WhatsApp status:
   - Ensure the number isn’t banned
   - Confirm the number is active

5️⃣ Still errors?
   - Delete & recreate the instance
   - Or contact support

text: Can you start warmup process thanks
response:
To enable warmup (important for new accounts!):

What is Warmup?
A process to 'warm up' a new WhatsApp account so WhatsApp doesn’t flag it as spam.

How to enable:
1. 'Instances' tab → select a new instance
2. Click 'Warmup Settings'
3. Toggle ON 'Enable Warmup'
4. Set warmup duration: 7–14 days
5. The system will automatically:
   - Send messages between your instances
   - Simulate normal chats
   - Gradually increase activity

Recommended for:
✅ New WhatsApp accounts (<30 days)
✅ Before your first big blast
✅ After long inactivity

⚠️ Don’t skip warmup! It can lead to bans!

text: Can you tell me how to why use warmup
response:
WhatsApp Warmup explained:

🔥 What is Warmup?
A gradual process to make a new WhatsApp account look like a normal user, not a bot/spammer.

❓ Why Warmup?
- WhatsApp has anti-spam algorithms
- New accounts blasting immediately = red flag
- Warmup = gradually build reputation
- Reduces ban risk by 80%+

🔧 How it works:
1. Instances A & B chat with each other (auto)
2. Simulate natural conversations
3. Delays between messages (human-like)
4. Gradually increase volume

⏱️ Duration:
- Minimum: 7 days
- Recommended: 14 days
- Intensive: 30 days

📊 Results:
- Higher account trust score
- Better delivery rate
- Minimal ban risk

Best practices:
✅ Warmup all new accounts
✅ Don’t blast >100 messages at once
✅ Build reputation first
✅ Monitor analytics

Patience pays off!

A gradual process to make a new WhatsApp account look like a normal user, not a bot/spammer.

❓ Why Warmup?
- WhatsApp has anti-spam algorithms
- New accounts blasting immediately = red flag
- Warmup = gradually build reputation
- Reduces ban risk by 80%+

🔧 How it works:
1. Instances A & B chat with each other (auto)
2. Simulate natural conversations
3. Delays between messages (human-like)
4. Gradually increase volume

⏱️ Duration:
- Minimum: 7 days
- Recommended: 14 days
- Intensive: 30 days

📊 Results:
- Higher account trust score
- Better delivery rate
- Minimal ban risk

Best practices:
✅ Warmup all new accounts
✅ Don’t blast >100 messages at once
✅ Build reputation first
✅ Monitor analytics

Patience pays off!
